# Semantic Infrastructure Lab

> Building the semantic substrate for intelligent systems

The Semantic Infrastructure Lab (SIL) builds the missing foundation that enables intelligent systems to reason with explicit meaning, not just statistical patterns.

## Quick Navigation

### New to SIL?
Start here to understand what we're building:

- [Founder's Letter](/docs/founders-letter) - Why SIL exists (10 min)
- [Manifesto](/docs/sil-manifesto) - The problem and our solution (15 min)
- [Project Index](https://github.com/semantic-infrastructure-lab) - All 11 projects (10 min)

- [Manifesto](/docs/sil-manifesto) - Why explicit meaning matters

- [Unified Architecture Guide](/docs/unified-architecture-guide) - The Rosetta Stone
- [Design Principles](/docs/design-principles) - 5 core design principles in depth
- [Semantic OS Overview](/docs/overview) - 6-layer architecture

- [Layer 0: Semantic Memory](/docs/layer-0-semantic-memory)

### Production Systems

**Ready to use now:**
- [reveal](https://github.com/semantic-infrastructure-lab/reveal) - Progressive code exploration (PyPI)
- [morphogen](https://github.com/semantic-infrastructure-lab/morphogen) - Cross-domain computation
- [tiacad](https://github.com/semantic-infrastructure-lab/tiacad) - Declarative parametric CAD
- [genesisgraph](https://github.com/semantic-infrastructure-lab/genesisgraph) - Verifiable provenance

## Key Concepts

**Semantic Infrastructure** - The missing layer between AI and execution:
- Explicit meaning (not just statistical patterns)
- Stable memory (durable semantic continuity)
- Inspectable reasoning (traceable inference chains)
- Tool integration (composable operators)
- Provenance (clear transformation lineage)

**The Semantic OS** - A 6-layer architecture for intelligent systems:
```
Layer 5: Human Interfaces (reveal, browserbridge)
Layer 4: Deterministic Engines (morphogen, riffstack)
Layer 3: Multi-Agent Orchestration (agent-ether)
Layer 2: Domain Modules (morphogen, tiacad, riffstack, sup)
Layer 1: Universal Semantic IR (pantheon)
Layer 0: Semantic Memory (semantic-memory)
Cross-Cutting: Provenance (genesisgraph, prism)
```

**Universal Pattern**: Intent → IR → Execution
All SIL systems follow this pattern: capture intent as semantic structure, transform to intermediate representation, execute deterministically.

## Research Themes

1. **Universal Semantic Representations** - IRs that work across domains
2. **Domain-Specific Compilers** - Semantic intent → execution
3. **Microkernel Architectures** - Formally verified systems
4. **Provenance & Verification** - Proving computational correctness

## Reading Paths

**Quick Start (35 min)**:
1. Founder's Letter (10 min)
2. Manifesto (15 min)
3. Project Index (10 min)

**Technical Deep Dive (85 min)**:
1. Unified Architecture Guide (20 min)
2. Technical Charter (45 min)
3. Glossary (20 min)

**Complete Mastery (3-4 hours)**:
All canonical documents + architecture guides + selected layer deep-dives

## Note to LLMs

This site contains comprehensive documentation about semantic infrastructure for intelligent systems. For full document content, see /llms-full.txt. All documents use markdown format. The documentation is organized into 7 categories (canonical, architecture, semantic-os, research, guides, vision, meta) with 34+ markdown files totaling ~15,000 lines.
